title: Minced Beef Curry
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Minced Beef Curry a try. Watching your figure? This gluten free, dairy free, paleolithic, and primal recipe has 513 calories, 32g of protein, and 32g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 2. For $2.39 per serving, this recipe covers 29% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 2 people have tried and liked this recipe. Not a lot of people really liked this Indian dish. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. A mixture of mince beef, some coriander, coriander powder, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. It is brought to you by Foodista. Overall, this recipe earns a solid spoonacular score of 71%. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Minced Beef Curry, Minced Mutton Curry, and Minced beef Wellington.
instructions:
Mix garam masala, turmeric,coriander, cumin and chilli powder with 2 tbsps of water. Set aside.
Fry the cumin seeds and the chopped onions with 3 tbsps full of oil on medium heat. Cook till the onions become golden brown.
Add the ginger garlic paste and spices to the onion mixture and fry till aromatic.
Then add the remaining ingredients into the mixture and  let it simmer on low heat.
When the oil starts to separate (a layer of oil form on top of the gravy), I add about half a cup of water and season with salt and allow the curry to simmer for a further 10 mins.
Finally, garnish with chopped coriander before you serve.

title: Pan Seared Fresh Maine Diver Scallops Creamy Avocado Champagne Grape Salad Teriyaki Cabernet Butter Sauce
summary: The recipe Pan Seared Fresh Maine Diver Scallops Creamy Avocado Champagne Grape Salad Teriyaki Cabernet Butter Sauce could satisfy your Japanese craving in approximately 45 minutes. This recipe serves 4. One portion of this dish contains around 9g of protein, 39g of fat, and a total of 574 calories. For $3.93 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Foodista requires avocado, u10 maine diver scallops, olive oil, and maui maid teriyaki. Only a few people really liked this hor d'oeuvre. It will be a hit at your new year eve event. 2 people were glad they tried this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian diet. With a spoonacular score of 46%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes include Left Over Wine or Champagne? No Problem! instructions:
1. In a sauce pan over medium heat reduce red wine down to 1/2 cup (almost syrupy)
  2. Add teriyaki sauce and simmer low heat for 1 minute, take off heat and keep warm
  3. Cube avocado and mix with champagne grapes, salt and pepper to taste
  4. Heat a saute pan to high heat with olive oil
  5. Salt and pepper scallops and sear on each side for 3 minutes
  6. Place pan with scallops in 450F for three minutes
  7. Whisk butter into teriyaki wine sauce till smooth
  8. Place scallops on plate with avocado grape salad
  9. With a spoon gently place sauce around entree

instructions.step 1: Mix first 8 ingredients together thoroughly then add salt & pepper and olive oil.
instructions.step 2: Form 8 thin patties with the meat mixture. Cut mozzarella into 1/4 inch pieces. On top of one patty, scatter 4-5 mozzarella pieces throughout the center of the meat leaving a little space between each cube. Be careful not to put cheese too close to the edges or it will leak out during grilling. Place another patty on top and seal edges together until cheese is completely buried.
instructions.step 3: Cut off the top of the red bell pepper and remove seeds and core. Then slice into 1/4 rings and brush lightly with olive oil.

In a food processor, pulse basil leaves, toasted pine nuts and salt & pepper. simultaneously adding olive oil through the feed tube. Once good puree is achieved, add the mayo and pulse 2-3 more times, scraping sides to make sure its thoroughly mixed.
instructions.step 5: Cook burgers meat over low to medium heat. Be sure to coat grill with non-stick spray. Cook about 8-10 minutes on each side. Try not to flip the burger too often as it tends to crumble. If the mozzarella starts to ooze out, don''t worry... that''s a sign that your burger is almost done.
instructions.step 6: Place red pepper rings on the upper or outer edges of grill. Cook 2-3 minutes on each side. Brush olive oil on the insides of both halves of the sourdough buns and also place on the upper or outer edges of grill. Remove when lightly toasted.
instructions.step 7: Spread pesto sauce on top & bottom bun. place spinach leaves on bottom bun and place meat on top of spinach leaves. Garnish top of meat with grilled red bell pepper, fold the halves together and you have La Bella Burger!

instructions.step 2: Roast garlic in a small pan until soft and fragrant.
instructions.step 3: Blend cauliflower, garlic, butter, and cream cheese until smooth.
instructions.step 4: Season with salt and pepper.
instructions.step 5: Garnish with chopped chives.

instructions.step 1: Season chicken with cajun seasoning and sear until cooked.
instructions.step 2: Cook fettuccine according to package instructions.
instructions.step 3: Sauté garlic in butter and add cream.
instructions.step 4: Stir in parmesan until melted.
instructions.step 5: Combine pasta, sauce, and sliced chicken.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry with Ginger Soy Glaze

instructions.step 1: Heat sesame oil in a wok.
instructions.step 2: Add vegetables and stir fry until crisp-tender.
instructions.step 3: Mix soy sauce, ginger, and garlic.
instructions.step 4: Pour glaze over vegetables and cook 2 minutes.
instructions.step 5: Serve over rice.

instructions.step 1: Sear chicken thighs until golden.
instructions.step 2: Sauté mushrooms and garlic in butter.
instructions.step 3: Add cream and thyme and simmer.
instructions.step 4: Return chicken to pan and cook until tender.
instructions.step 5: Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

instructions.step 1: Toss shrimp with lime juice, chili sauce, salt, and pepper.
instructions.step 2: Cook shrimp in a skillet until pink.
instructions.step 3: Fill tortillas with cabbage and shrimp.
instructions.step 4: Top with cilantro and extra lime.

instructions.step 1: Sear beef strips until browned.
instructions.step 2: Cook onions and mushrooms in butter.
instructions.step 3: Add flour and broth to create a sauce.
instructions.step 4: Stir in sour cream and return beef to pan.
instructions.step 5: Serve over egg noodles.

instructions.step 1: Rinse quinoa thoroughly.
instructions.step 2: Cook quinoa in broth until fluffy.
instructions.step 3: Stir in lemon zest, juice, garlic, and olive oil.
instructions.step 4: Season and garnish with parsley.

title: Creamy Broccoli Cheddar Soup
ingredients:
4 Tbsp unsalted butter
1 small yellow onion, diced
3 garlic cloves, minced
¼ cup flour
1 tsp salt
¼ tsp black pepper
¼-½ tsp crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
2 cups half & half
2 cups chicken broth
½ tsp smooth dijon mustard
4 cups broccoli florets, chopped
1 carrot, grated/shredded (about ¾ cup)
2 cups (heaping) shredded cheddar cheese
summary: Creamy, cheesy & ready in 30 minutes! This stovetop broccoli cheddar soup is everything you want in a cozy weekenight meal. Loaded with tender broccoli & melty cheddar cheese - it's a delicious homemade soup recipe the whole family will love!

instructions.step 1: Sauté onions and carrots in butter.
instructions.step 2: Add flour to create a roux.
instructions.step 3: Pour in milk and cream and simmer.
instructions.step 4: Add broccoli and cook until tender.
instructions.step 5: Stir in cheddar until melted.

instructions.step 3: Mix honey, mustard, garlic, and thyme.

instructions.step 5: Serve warm.

instructions.step 1: Add all ingredients to a blender.

instructions.step 3: Serve immediately.
